Sentencas: Based on the current models of solid oxide fuel cells and two-heat-source heat engines consisting of two isothermal and two polytropic processes, a general model of a class of fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems is established, in which multi-irreversibilities existing in real hybrid systems are taken into account.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems

Sentencas: Expressions for the efficiency and power output of the hybrid systems are analytically derived from the model.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems

Sentencas: The curves of the efficiency and power output of the hybrid systems varying with the current density and the efficiency versus power output curves are represented through numerical calculation.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems

Sentencas: The general performance characteristics of the hybrid systems are revealed and the optimum criteria of the main performance parameters are determined.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems

Sentencas: The effects of some key irreversibilities existing in the fuel cell, regenerator and two-heat-source heat engine on the performance of the hybrid systems are discussed in detail.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems

Sentencas: The results obtained here are very general and may be directly used to derive the various interesting conclusions of the hybrid systems which are operated under different special cases.
Titulo: Performance analysis and parametric optimum criteria of a class of irreversible fuel cell/heat engine hybrid systems
